content: pattern by danielle quiggins anyloop_dq alternating cables headband keep your ears cozy during the cold winter months with this fun stylish cabled headband the chunky yarn adds extra softness and warmth and makes this pattern a breeze to work up alternating distance between the cable twists adds visual interest but is simple enough for a first time cable project note slipped stitches are always slipped purlwise cable twist row always happen on the right side of the fabric abbreviations bobble bind off c6f transfer next 3 sts to a cable needle and hold to the front of work knit the next 3 sts knit the 3 sts from the cable needle co cast on k knit p purl r row repeat repeat rs right side of fabric sl1wyib slip one stitch purlwise with yarn held to the back sl1wyif slip one stitch purlwise with yarn held to the front st s stitch es ws wrong side of fabric materials 8mm us size 11 needles one ball chunky yarn approx 35 yards/ 37meters will be used blunt tip yarn needle for weaving in ends sizes adult size to fit 21-22 / 53-56cm head with 2-3 / 5-8cm negative ease finished item 3 5 / 9cm wide x 19 / 48cm circ child size to fit 19-20 / 48-51cm head with 2-3 / 5-8cm negative ease finished item 3 5 / 9cm wide x 17 / 43cm circ 1 pattern instructions co 14 sts r1 ws p2 k2 p6 k2 p2 r2 rs sl1wyib k1 p2 k6 p2 k2 r3 ws sl1wyif p1 k2 p6 k2 p2 r4 rs sl1wyib k1 p2 k6 p2 k2 r5 repeat r3 r6 sl1wyib k1 p2 c6f p2 k2 r7-14 repeat r3 and r4 four times r15 repeat r3 r16 sl1wyib k1 p2 c6f p2 k2 r17-22 repeat r3 and r4 three times r23 repeat r3 r24 sl1wyib k1 p2 c6f p2 k2 *repeat r7-24 until the headband measures 18 / 45cm for adult size or 16 / 40cm for child size ending after a rs cable twist row ws repeat r3 rs repeat r4 ws repeat r3 rs bobble and cut a long yarn tail approx 8 / 20cm block the finished headband to schematic size specifications sew the co and bobble edges together and sew in any remaining yarn ends schematic 2
